prop.head.headtext: Handling Cases Before the Judicial Panel on Multidistrict Litigation

para.paratext: Like other federal courts, the Panel requires that private corporate parties file a corporate disclosure statement.[1] The purpose of this rule is to permit Panel members to determine if there are relationships that might require either disclosure or recusal. Not surprisingly given the number of parties involved in dockets before the Panel, Panel members have found it necessary to recuse themselves, and in some cases even a majority of the Panel have had to do so.[2] In that circumstance the Panel has invoked the “rule of necessity,” recognized by the United States Supreme Court,[3] to have all members participate in the decision. Panel members have also formally renounced any potential claims in order to avoid potential disqualification or appearance of bias issues.[4]
Maslon Edelman Borman & Brand, LLP, Minneapolis, Minnesota.
J.P.M.L. R. 5.1. The Panel rules are reproduced in § 4:34.
